title: Integrated Functional Modeling and GeoGebra Simulation Course for Conceptual and Procedural Understanding of Derivatives

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental function concepts (linear, polynomial, trigonometric), interpretation of graph slopes, and basic understanding of differential notation
context.additional_context: Emphasis on real-time collaboration and simulation activities using personal devices (BYOD). Project-based assessments evaluate the ability to connect multiple representations (symbols, graphs, applied problems).

learning_goals: Students can explain the conceptual meaning of derivatives through slope analysis for various function types (linear, polynomial, trigonometric)
Students can visually analyze and explain the relationship between derivative coefficients and derivative graphs of functions using GeoGebra simulations
Students can perform mathematical modeling by applying derivative concepts to real-life problems (e.g., velocity, acceleration, optimization)
Students can achieve over 85% procedural fluency in derivatives through tasks integrating symbolic computation and graphical interpretation

resources: Worksheet on Application of Derivative Concepts

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
